message.content:
cs.CR, cs.NI, cs.SY, cs.DC, cs.LG

The paper discusses a novel approach to privacy in networks, specifically in the context of the Internet of Things (IoT). The paper proposes a scheme based on changing the IP addresses of IoT nodes to prevent an adversary from identifying the source or destination of a particular transmission. This approach falls under the category of network security and privacy, which is covered by the cs.CR (Cryptography and Security) sub-category. Additionally, the paper discusses the implementation and evaluation of the proposed scheme, which involves networking and system components, making cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) and cs.SY (Systems and Control) likely sub-categories as well. The paper also mentions the benefits of the scheme in terms of DoS mitigation, which falls under the category of distributed computing, making cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing) a possible sub-category. Finally, the paper proposes a relatively easy-to-implement scheme that requires no changes to the existing networking infrastructure, which could be considered a machine learning approach, making cs.LG (Machine Learning) a possible sub-category as well.
